intro: Mapouria microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited mapouria, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. Mapouria microcarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
